props.title: What Are Loops?
props.prompt: Loops allow you to repeat code blocks multiple times without writing the same code repeatedly. In this module, you'll learn two main types: for loops and while loops. For loops repeat a set number of times, while while loops repeat until a condition becomes false. Let's start by understanding the basic syntax and then practice writing loops in real code.

props.title: Write Your First For Loop
props.starterCode:
# Write a for loop that prints numbers 1 to 5
# Complete the code below:

for i in range(1, 6):
    print(i)

metadata.title: Feedback Box
metadata.description: Shows correctness, explanation, and next steps

props.title: Great Job on Your First Loop!
props.message: You've successfully written and executed a for loop!
props.explanation: The for loop iterates through each number in the range 1-5 and prints it. The range(1, 6) function generates numbers from 1 up to (but not including) 6, so you get 1, 2, 3, 4, 5.
nextSteps: Try modifying the range to print different numbers

props.title: Master While Loops
props.starterCode:
# Write a while loop that counts from 1 to 5
# Complete the code below:

count = 1
while count <= 5:
    print(count)
    count += 1

metadata.title: Feedback Box
metadata.description: Shows correctness, explanation, and next steps

props.title: Excellent While Loop Implementation!
props.message: You've successfully written and executed a while loop!
props.explanation: The while loop continues as long as the condition (count <= 5) is true. The count variable increments by 1 each iteration using count += 1. This is different from a for loop because you manually control when the loop stops.
nextSteps: Compare for loops and while loops
